page.title: 14CUSTOMS OF RAMSBOTTOM
page.content: A popular{tradition}with all local people is to walk to Peel Tower on {Holcombe Hill}on Good Friday each year. A church service is held on the hiil-side, a local theatrical group perform a traditional play and there are also refreshment stands, stalls and side-shows. The annual Peel Lion's "Peel Trek" also takes place in April in Holcombe.People are sponsored to walk as many laps as they can around a set course on the hill.Monies raised are for local charities. Another tradition is for{churches}to elect a Rose Queen, usually a 10-13 year old girl. The Rose Queen represents the church and Sunday-School at fund-raising events for the local churches. On Whit-Sunday , the choir, congregations, uniformed organisations and societies of local churches form a procession-{The Whit Walk.}
